title: Relative coverage of causes of death in the New York Times (NYT)
subtitle: Relative coverage of articles mentioning the top 10 causes of death in the USA (in addition to terrorism, homicide and drug overdoses) in the New York Times (NYT). This is based on the number of articles which mention any of the terms or synonym/related terms (e.g. 'murder' for homicide) in the headline or body text. This is normalized to the relative share by dividing by the total number of articles which feature any of these causes of death.
sourceDesc: Shen et al. (2018). Based on the New York Times article database.
